text: An advance care planning model is feasible for community palliative care services. Quality audit processes are an essential component of the Model with documentation of advance care planning discussion established as an important outcome measure.

Yes, an advance care planning model is feasible in community palliative care. It helps individuals make decisions about their future healthcare and ensures their preferences are respected, even if they are unable to communicate them

Long-term dietary compliance in screen-detected patients was good. Quality of life and bone mineral density were comparable with those in non-coeliac subjects and the general population. Active screening in coeliac disease risk groups seems to be reasonable rather than harmful.

Yes, coeliac disease screening in risk groups is justified. Risk groups include individuals with a family history of the disease, those with autoimmune disorders, and individuals with symptoms like chronic diarrhea or weight loss. Early detection and diagnosis can lead

Systolic BP measured by the nurse in treated hypertensive patients is significantly lower than the readings obtained by the physician, and are almost identical to ambulatory BP monitoring. Blood pressure determination by the nurse is desirable not only for diagnosis but also to evaluate the level of control of blood pressure during

There may be slight variations in blood pressure measurements between physicians and nurses when treating hypertensive patients, but these differences are generally considered to be minimal and not clinically significant. It is important to ensure that both physicians and nurses follow standardized protocols and use accurate measurement techniques to obtain reliable readings.

In our experience, definitive radiotherapy to the neck and the potential mucosal sites, whether preceded by neck dissection or not, is effective to achieve a good local control rate in the unknown primary cancer of the head and neck. The indication for neck dissection, in particular for early nodal

In cases of metastatic carcinoma to the cervical nodes from an unknown head and neck primary site, a neck dissection may be necessary to remove the affected lymph nodes and determine the primary source of the cancer. This procedure can help guide further treatment decisions and improve patient outcomes.
To date, the newly developed Singapore equation is the most accurate BMR prediction equation in Chinese and is applicable for
The applicability of current prediction equations for estimating basal metabolic rate in Chinese individuals needs further investigation to ensure accuracy.
This paper discusses the cultural appropriateness of the RAQ in Australian settings, and identifies the need to develop rigorous, inclusive recovery outcome measures.
Yes, recovery outcome measures should consider the influence of culture, attitudes, and faith as they play a significant role in an individual's journey

With monitoring of MEP and SSEP, sacrifice--without reimplantation--of as many as 15 intercostal and lumbar arteries during TAA/A repair is safe, resulting in acceptably low rates of immediate and delayed paraplegia. This experience suggests that routine surgical implantation of segmental vessels is

Reimplantation of spinal cord arteries during thoracic and thoracoabdominal aneurysm repair is not considered a waste of time. It is an essential procedure that helps to ensure adequate blood supply to the spinal cord, reducing the risk of paraplegia and other complications.

There is a dearth of studies addressing diagnostic and treatment interventions in the sports medicine literature. The evidence base for sports medicine must continue to increase in terms of volume and quality.

Yes, sports medicine journals are relevant and applicable to practitioners and athletes as they provide up-to-date research, information, and guidelines on various aspects of sports medicine, including injury prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and
We conclude that beta1Gly49 homozygosity and TACC haplotype of ADRB2 gene, both loss-of-function genetic variations, may predispose to TTN.
The role of polymorphisms in beta-adrenergic receptor encoding genes in transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN) is currently being

We report for the first time ESLD etiology as a prognostic factor for survival. The renal function (expressed as serum creatinine) and urinary Na (<5 mEq/l) at the time of diagnosis were found to be associated with

Current research suggests that there may be additional prognostic factors for hepatorenal syndrome that have not yet been identified. Further studies are needed to explore these potential factors and improve the understanding and management of this condition.

In our study, we suggest that glomerular hyperfiltration due to pregnancy does not have adverse effects on kidney in women with more parities. Pregnancy may have possible protective mechanisms for kidney against adverse effects of glomerular hyperfiltration.

Research suggests that glomerular hyperfiltration during pregnancy does not necessarily lead to kidney damage in women with more parities. However, further studies are needed to fully understand the long-term effects and potential risks associated with glomerular hyperfiltration
Both hsCRP levels and the carotid IMT were strongly correlated with conventional
Yes, high-sensitivity C-reactive protein is associated with carotid atherosclerosis in healthy Koreans.

The majority of acetabular components in this cohort were stable despite the small contact surface achieved between the component and pelvic bone. Three of 10 migrated in excess of the limits that predict later loosening

Current evidence suggests that cup-cage reconstruction with oversized cups can provide initial stability in total hip arthroplasty (THA) for osteoporotic acetabular fractures. However, further research is needed to fully understand its effectiveness and long-term outcomes.
Among patients receiving MMT and medical care at different sites, documentation of opioid dependence and MMT in the medical record occurs for the majority, but is missing in a
Yes, opioid dependence and methadone maintenance treatment (MMT) should be documented in the medical record as they are important factors in a patient's medical history and ongoing treatment plan.
Older adults enrolled in PICT with more symptoms may sacrifice QOL for experimental treatment.
Yes, symptoms do matter when considering patients for phase I clinical trials. This is
Expert breast pathology assessments continue to be necessary in the management of DCIS.
Yes, expert breast pathology assessment is necessary for the management of ductal carcinoma in

There was increased expression of TGF-β1 and VEGF in polyps compared to adjacent normal endometrial tissue. It suggested that these cytokines might play a role in endometrial polyp formation. In addition, there was a significant correlation between steroid receptor expression and VEGF and TGF-β1 expression.

Yes, endometrial polyp formation has been found to be associated with increased expression of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and transforming growth factor-beta1 (TGF-beta1). These growth factors play a role in angiogenesis and tissue remodeling, which may contribute to the development and growth of endometrial

There was little evidence that people at high risk of falls received systematic falls risk assessment during rehabilitation. When a risk was identified, generally a strategy was implemented. However, failure to

It is unclear whether patients at high risk of falls are adequately prepared for discharge home after rehabilitation. Further evaluation is needed to determine if current practices align with established guidelines.

The frequency and topographic distribution of LNM are not modified by NACT, and clinical non-responders showed more involved LNs. A systemic and extensive lymphadenectomy should be performed in patients treated with NACT plus surgery regardless

The extent of lymphadenectomy in cervical cancer could potentially be modified by neoadjuvant chemotherapy. However, further research is needed to determine the optimal approach and to evaluate the benefits and potential risks of this modification.
Our data, derived from patients with coronary artery disease, support the hypothesis regarding a possible preventive effect of bezafibrate on the development of colon cancer.
There is limited evidence suggesting that bezafibrate, a lipid-lowering drug that activates peroxisome proliferator-activated receptors, may have a preventive effect on colon cancer in patients

In patients with clinically apparent unilateral pseudoexfoliation, the lens seems to be more mobile in the affected eye. This results in a shallower anterior chamber when the head is placed in a prone position.

There is limited evidence suggesting that head positioning may have an influence on anterior chamber depth in pseudoexfoliation syndrome. Further research is needed to confirm these findings and determine the extent of the relationship.

This study demonstrates that hospital management can stimulate the development of care programmes by the adoption of case-mix reimbursement within hospitals' budgeting processes. Future research is recommended to confirm this finding and to determine whether the establishment of care programmes will in time indeed lead to a more

Case-mix based reimbursement can stimulate the development of process-oriented care delivery by incentivizing healthcare providers to focus on delivering efficient and effective care. By linking reimbursement to patient complexity and outcomes, healthcare organizations are encouraged to improve their processes, coordination, and quality of care to receive appropriate reimbursement.

Data from Safe Implementation of Treatments in Stroke-International Stroke Thrombolysis Register suggest that intravenous thrombolysis may modify the observed survival and recovery advantage for men expected in the natural course of an ischemic stroke,

Sex does not appear to influence the response to intravenous thrombolysis in ischemic stroke, according to a study. Both males and females showed similar rates of recanalization and functional outcome after receiving this treatment.
Emergency laparotomy carries a high rate of mortality, especially in those over the age of 70 years, and more needs to be done to improve outcomes,
Yes, the 30-day and 1-year mortality rates in emergency general surgery laparotomies are a cause for concern and indicate the need for improvement in the field.
Our findings suggest routine BS of patients presenting with MBC is not required if CT (thorax, abdomen, and pelvis) is performed.
Computerised tomography (CT) and bone scintigraphy are both imaging techniques used to detect bone metastases from breast cancer. While CT can

epiDWI has the potential to differentiate pleomorphic adenoma and myoepithelial adenomas from all other examined entities. Due to an overlap not only within the group of benign and malignant lesions but

Diffusion-weighted echo-planar MR imaging can potentially predict different histologic subtypes of primary parotid gland tumors. However, further research and studies are needed to validate its accuracy and reliability in clinical practice.

The advice to perform a concomitant splenectomy in children with mild HS undergoing cholecystectomy for symptomatic gallstones needs revisiting. In the era of minimal access surgery, the need for splenectomy in such children should be judged on its own merits.

The indication for concomitant splenectomy in mild hereditary spherocytosis is still a subject of debate among medical professionals. While cholecystectomy may be necessary to treat gallstones in these patients, the need for splenectomy depends on individual factors such as spleen

This longitudinal study found no significant effect of menopausal transition on quality of life among Taiwanese women. The decline in the role limitations due to emotional problems was related to vasomotor symptoms.

Yes, menopausal transition can affect the quality of life due to symptoms such as hot flashes, mood swings, sleep disturbances, and reduced sexual desire. However, the impact varies for each woman, and

Better prognosis was obtained when ruptured aneurysm was repaired in the elderly than it was treated conservatively. From the results of this study, we should not hesitate to offer the definitive surgery for the elderly with aSAH.

The decision to repair aneurysms in patients aged 80 or older after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage should be based on individual patient factors, overall health, and potential benefits versus risks. A thorough assessment by a healthcare professional is

Isolated sternal fractures in childhood are often due to typical age-related traumatic incidents. Ultrasonography is a useful diagnostic tool for fracture detection and radiography is the method of choice for visualization of the extent of the dislocation.

A sternal fracture in growing children is a rare type of fracture that is often overlooked. It can be challenging to diagnose due to the cartilaginous nature of the sternum in children. However, early identification and proper
Emergency DBE is feasible, safe and effective in acute OGIB and may avoid major surgery, diagnosing and successfully treating most patients.
Yes, emergency double-balloon enteroscopy combined with real-time viewing of capsule endoscopy is a feasible combined approach in acute overt-obscure gastrointestinal bleeding.

Hypotheses for this discontent are presented. Physicians may be uninterested in helping caregivers; even if they were receptive to counseling caregivers, they could be poorly remunerated for the types of counseling sessions that are usual for caregivers; and being a professional caregiver to family caregivers

There is ongoing debate on whether physicians are adequately addressing the needs of family caregivers of the frail elderly. While some argue that healthcare providers are not doing enough to support caregivers, others believe that efforts are being made to improve caregiver education and resources.

Pap smears with glandular cell abnormalities are often flagged as abnormal by RPS, and this results in a sensitivity of 36.4% (at the AGC threshold). Most importantly, some cases of AGC are detected on Pap smears by RPS

Rapid prescreening methods, such as liquid-based cytology, can effectively detect glandular cell abnormalities in Pap smears. However, further evaluation and confirmation through specialized testing, such as colposcopy and biopsy, are often required for accurate diagnosis and appropriate management.

Surgery may improve blood lipid levels in patients with OSA, especially in patients with preoperative dyslipidemia, potentially yielding a major benefit in metabolism and cardiovascular sequelae. Prospective studies should examine this

There is limited evidence suggesting that airway surgery may lower serum lipid levels in obstructive sleep apnea patients, but further research is needed to establish a clear connection between the two.
Our results give first evidence that lowered beta E during alcohol withdrawal may contribute to anxiety as a common disturbance during this state.
Withdrawal-induced anxiety in alcoholism may be associated with a beta-endorphin deficiency. Beta-endorphins are natural peptides that play a role in regulating mood and
The study data suggests a possible correlation between cervical discopathy and cervical MS plaque.
There is no direct relation between cervical cord plaques and discopathy in patients with

Patients on AIs who develop osteoporosis are at increased risk of musculoskeletal symptoms and bone fracture. Comedication with Ca/Bis reduces the likelihood for osteoporosis and musculoskeletal symptoms. Patients who received tamoxifen before AIs were less likely to develop AI-related musculoskeletal symptoms. We recommend

Preventing osteoporosis may not be the sole solution to eliminating aromatase inhibitor-related musculoskeletal symptoms. While maintaining bone health is important, addressing other factors such as inflammation, hormonal imbalances, and individual patient characteristics may also play a significant role in managing these symptoms effectively.
Increased D-dimer levels should not be considered as a diagnostic parameter in diagnosis of acute appendicitis.
Recent studies have shown that D-dimer, a blood test used to detect the presence of blood
Switching to automatic transmission may be recommended for older drivers as a means to maintain safe driving and thereby the quality of their transport mobility.
There is limited research on the specific impact of automatic transmission on driving behavior in older drivers. However, it is generally believed that automatic transmission

In male HIV-infected patients older than 52 years and with at least two other CRFs, screening for SMI using myocardial SPECT was about four times more likely to be positive than in the general population. This may motivate physicians to advise these patients to undergo more systematic screening for SMI using

There is currently no consensus on whether HIV-infected patients should be routinely screened for silent myocardial ischemia using gated myocardial perfusion SPECT. Further research is needed to evaluate the benefits, risks, and cost-effectiveness of such screening in this population. Clinicians should consider individual patient factors and guidelines when making screening decisions.

MSWM does not appear to confer additional benefit as compared to the standard preoperative bariatric surgery protocol in terms of weight loss and most behavioral outcomes after LAGB in our patient population.

There is evidence to suggest that a preoperative medically supervised weight loss program can improve outcomes for bariatric surgery. It can help patients achieve weight loss, reduce surgical risks, and improve long-term

The idea that Indigenous people age prematurely is not well supported by this study of a series of discrete conditions. The current focus and type of services provided by the aged care sector may not be

There is no scientific evidence to suggest that Indigenous Australians age prematurely. However, factors such as socioeconomic disadvantage, access to healthcare, and lifestyle choices may contribute to health issues that can affect the overall aging process.
Most people in France are influenced by situational factors when deciding if a physician should breach confidentiality to protect the spouse of a patient infected with STD.
The acceptability of breaching confidentiality to protect a patient's wife from a sexually transmitted disease may vary among French lay people and health professionals. It is important

Primary eosinophilic esophagitis is characterized by fragile esophageal mucosa that readily tears in response to minor trauma during otherwise uneventful diagnostic endoscopy. This "crêpe-paper" sign may alert endoscopists to the presence of the disease when other

The fragility of the esophageal mucosa may be a significant endoscopic sign of primary eosinophilic esophagitis, indicating potential damage and inflammation in the esophagus. However, further diagnostic tests and evaluations are necessary to confirm the diagnosis.

This group of elderly stroke patients were able to record their BPs reliably at home. Any bias was small and would be unlikely to affect management. Since BP readings in a GP surgery are often a poor indication of true BP, GPs might consider using hypertensive

The reliability of stroke patients' reports of home blood pressure readings may vary. It is important for healthcare professionals to assess the accuracy and consistency of these readings through validation methods, such as comparing them to in-clinic measurements or using automated home blood pressure monitoring devices.
ACR is an independent prognostic factor for maternal and neonatal adverse outcomes in suspected preeclampsia. ACR may be useful to inform risk
The first urinary albumin/creatinine ratio (ACR) in women with suspected preeclampsia is not a prognostic factor for maternal and neonatal adverse outcome.

After 4 weeks' acid-suppressive therapy for LA grade C or D oesophagitis, successful healing appears to reach a threshold above which improvements are unlikely to be achieved despite an increase in number of hours with intragastric pH>4.

There is currently no consensus on the optimal time of acid suppression for maximal healing of Los Angeles grades C and D reflux oesophagitis. Further research is needed to determine the most effective duration of acid suppression

The senior urologist was capable of resecting four times more tissue per time unit than the more inexperienced surgeons. Therefore, a surgeon's experience may be important to reduce the risk of secondary TURP due to recurring adenomas or

Yes, the ability to perform transurethral resection of the prostate is influenced by the surgeon's previous experience. Experience allows the surgeon to develop skills, knowledge, and expertise, which are crucial for successfully performing the procedure and minimizing complications.
Clinical predictors appear inadequate for the evaluation of the cervical spine in geriatric trauma patients with low-energy mechanism.
The adequacy of clinical predictors for cervical spine fractures in geriatric blunt trauma patients with low-energy mechanism is

As age at manifestation and course of the disease may be rather variable, even in carriers of identical germline mutations, therapeutic decisions should be based on colonoscopic findings in individual patients rather than on the site of mutation. However, in patients with mutations

Yes, APC mutation analysis can help in determining the appropriate therapeutic approach for individuals with familial adenomatous polyposis. It can provide valuable information about the specific mutation present, which can guide treatment decisions such as the use of targeted therapies or surgical interventions.

The geriatric oncology consultation led to a modification of the cancer treatment plan in more than one third of cases. Further studies are needed to determine whether these modifications improve the outcome of these older patients.

Yes, a geriatric oncology consultation can modify the cancer treatment plan for elderly patients. This specialized consultation takes into consideration the unique needs and circumstances of older adults, such as their overall health, comorbidities, and functional
A possible decreased transformation of procarcinogens by CYP2D6*4 poor metabolisers could result in a protective effect against carcinogens.
There is currently no evidence to suggest a direct association between the CYP2D6*4 allele and breast cancer risk.

Overall, in a US Air Force population, OSA does not predict a decrease in aerobic fitness as measured by cycle ergometry. However, patients with an apnea-hypopnea index of greater than 20 have a statistically significant decrease in aerobic fitness compared to the normal population. This study

Yes, obstructive sleep apnea can affect aerobic fitness. It is characterized by repeated interruptions in breathing during sleep, leading to decreased oxygen supply to the body. This can result in fatigue, reduced endurance, and impaired aerobic performance. Treatment of sleep apnea can help improve aerobic fitness.

The results of this study cast doubt on the importance of LOC as a predictor of neuropsychological test performance during the acute phase of recovery from mild traumatic brain injury. Neuropsychological testing

There is evidence to suggest that loss of consciousness may be a predictor of neuropsychological deficits following a concussion, however, further research is needed to fully understand the relationship between these factors.
Early treatment and use of triptans may lead to shorter duration from migraine headache onset to its peak but did not alleviate headache
Early migraine treatment has been shown to shorten the time it takes for a headache to reach its peak and reduce its severity.

Urbanicity was associated with increases in behavioral and physiological risk factors. However, these associations may not translate directly into increases in biological risk factors. It is likely that these biological risk factors were results of a complex interaction between both long term accumulation of exposure and early life

Timing does matter when it comes to living in an urban environment and the risk of non-communicable diseases in Thailand. Factors such as the duration of exposure, time spent outdoors, and the timing of activities can all play a role in determining the impact on an individual's health.
Evaluation of living arrangements is crucial for identifying and explaining gender differences in mortality risks by marital status. The impact of living alone and living with a partner seems to

The association between marital status, living arrangement, and mortality may vary depending on gender. Further research is needed to determine the specific differences and factors that contribute to these variations.

The results of these analyses suggest that marginally higher rates of depression to age 35 amongst the comorbid MD/AUD group were explained by increased exposure to adverse childhood circumstances amongst members of the comorbid group. Adolescent MD/AUD comorbidity is likely to be

Comorbidity of major depression and alcohol use disorder in adolescence can lead to poorer outcomes of depression, as the two conditions can exacerbate each other and prolong the duration of depressive episodes. Treatment should address both conditions simultaneously to achieve better outcomes.

These data suggest that the R14C KCNQ1 mutation alone is insufficient to cause AF. Rather, we suggest a model in which a "second hit", such as an environmental factor like hypertension, which promotes atrial stretch and thereby

The stretch-sensitive KCNQ1 mutation may indicate a connection between genetic and environmental factors in the development of atrial fibrillation. Further research is needed to fully understand the role of this mutation in the pathogenesis of the condition.

Clinical assessment is the key to diagnose appendicitis. Nevertheless, in girls older than 10 years, selected use of imaging should be implemented to avoid unnecessary appendectomies. Imaging of choice in equivocal cases should be

Yes, imaging is typically required to diagnose appendicitis in children. Common imaging techniques include ultrasound and computed tomography (CT) scans. These tests help to visualize the inflamed appendix and provide a more accurate diagnosis.

General surgery research residents' intraoperative leadership skills showed significant correlations to their perceptions of skill decay and task difficulty during a bowel repair. Evaluating resident's directional instructions may provide an additional individualized intraoperative assessment metric. Further evaluation

There is no direct correlation between a resident's leadership skills and their ratings of technical skill. Leadership skills and technical skills are distinct qualities that contribute to overall competency, but one does not necessarily impact the other.
Men and women in this community sample reported similar patterns of depressive symptoms. No evidence that the presentation of depressive symptoms differs by gender was found.
There is evidence to suggest that higher rates of depression in women may be partially explained by differential symptom reporting. Women tend to report more symptoms

In patients with ischaemic heart disease and hypotension, symptomatic and silent ischaemia occurred in a temporally causal relation with hypotension, particularly for diastolic pressures, suggesting that patients with coronary disease may be susceptible to ischaemic events

Hypotensive events in patients with coronary disease can potentially lead to myocardial ischemic events. Profound drops in blood pressure can decrease the oxygen supply to the heart, resulting in ischemia and potentially triggering a heart attack.

Many factors contribute to the erroneous reporting of hCG results, including (a) the complexity of hCG molecule and confusion of nomenclature on the various forms of hCG; (b) laboratory personnel's lack of awareness

It is crucial for laboratories to accurately report serum quantitative hCG results to ensure reliable diagnostic information. Regular quality control measures and adherence to established guidelines and protocols can help ensure accurate reporting.

In vitro fertilization outcome is strongly correlated with both maternal ages, basal cycle, day 3 follicle, stimulated hormone, and antral follicle assessment. Antral follicle assessment was a better predictor of in vitro fertilization outcome than were age or follicle stimulated hormone. Antral

Antral follicle assessment can provide valuable information for predicting IVF outcome. Although age and FSH levels are important factors, antral follicle count can offer additional insight into a woman's ovarian reserve and potential response to treatment, making it a potentially better predictor.

We found evidence that pain can be a significant clinical problem in psychiatric patients which seems to be underestimated in psychiatry. The investigated patients in general adult psychiatry are characterized by specific risk factors different from clinical subpopulations of other disciplines.

Yes, pain is a clinically relevant problem in general adult psychiatry as it is often associated with mental health conditions such as depression, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress disorder. Treating pain alongside psychiatric symptoms is crucial for comprehensive patient care and improving

A reduced alveolar macrophage phagocytic host response to apoptotic cells or NTHi may contribute to neutrophilic inflammation and NTHi colonization in both PBB and bronchiectasis. Whether this mechanism also contributes to the progression of PBB to bronchiectasis remains unknown.

The relationship between Alveolar Macrophage Phagocytic Dysfunction in children with Protracted Bacterial Bronchitis and Bronchiectasis is still being studied and there is no definitive answer at this time. Further research is needed to determine if there is a causal

Improving hospital efficiency by shortening length of stay does not appear to result in increased rates of readmission or numbers of physician visits within 30 days after discharge from hospital. Research is needed to identify optimal lengths of stay and expected readmission rates.

The impact of discharging patients earlier from Winnipeg hospitals on the quality of care is a complex issue that requires further investigation. While it may lead to increased patient satisfaction and reduced healthcare costs, potential risks such as inadequate follow-up care and readmission
An optimistic outlook appears to be a significant predictor of survival among the oldest-old women. It may also be a significant predictor for men but the sample size is small.

Research has shown that optimism can positively impact health and well-being, including survival rates at advanced ages. Optimistic individuals tend to have better coping strategies, healthier lifestyles, stronger immune function,

Grandmultiparous women had increased maternal and neonatal morbidity, and neonatal mortality even after controlling for confounders, suggesting a need for closer observation than regular multiparous patients during labor and delivery.
Yes, grandmultiparity (defined as giving birth to 5 or more children) has been identified as an independent risk factor for adverse perinatal outcomes, including preterm birth, low birth weight, and

Generalization of the RCT sample was supported, because only 7.8% of Phenomenology subjects did not fit the RCT criteria. Nevertheless, because the RCT subjects were more severely ill, it is unclear if treatment findings from the RCT will be applicable to children with less severe mania.

The "Treatment of Early Age Mania (TEAM)" sample may not generalize to all cases of child bipolar I disorder. Diagnostic characteristics may vary among individuals, and further research is needed to determine if the findings of the TEAM sample can be applied to a broader population.

The Medicaid Demonstration in Florida appears to result in lower PMPM expenditures. Demonstration PSNs generated slightly greater reductions in expenditures compared to Demonstration HMOs. PSNs appear to be a promising model for delivering care to Medicaid enrollees.

Provider service networks (PSNs) have been found to result in lower expenditures compared to Health Maintenance Organizations (HMOs) or primary care case management in Florida's Medicaid program. This is due to the increased flexibility and efficiency offered
This study showed that FDG is not a good surrogate tracer for tumor hypoxia under either ambient or hypoxic conditions. Only specific hypoxia
No, (18)F-FDG is not a surrogate tracer to measure tumor hypoxia. It is used to measure glucose metabolism in tumors, not oxygen levels.

BPPV is associated with positive viral serology, particularly during certain months of the year, mainly in spring and autumn. Viral infection might promote BPPV attacks due to the development of vestibulopathy or induce secondary BPPV via viral infection-related neurolabyrinthitis.

The exact cause of benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) is not fully understood, but viral infections are not believed to have a direct role in its development. BPPV is typically caused by problems in the inner ear, such as
Correlation between level of radiographic transition zone on contrast enema and length of aganglionosis remains low. Systematic preoperative biopsy
Yes, the radiographic transition zone in Hirschsprung's disease typically correlates with the level of aganglionosis observed on the specimen.

The independent protective effect of female gender on multiple organ failure and nosocomial infection rates remains significant in both premenopausal and postmenopausal women when compared with similarly aged men. This is contrary to previous experimental studies and the known

The characterization of gender dimorphism after injury and hemorrhagic shock suggests that hormonal differences may be responsible. Further research is needed to fully understand the role of hormones in these conditions and their impact on outcomes and treatment strategies.

Our data suggest that UHR intake criteria predict transition over 6 months in the order of Trait alone<APS<BLIPS. The fact that BLIPS patients are at the highest risk of transition over the short term is consistent with the "early" versus "late" prodrome model. It also indicates

Yes, there are different levels of risk for transition to psychosis within the Ultra High Risk (UHR) criteria. These levels include basic symptoms, brief limited intermittent psychotic symptoms, and attenuated psychotic symptoms. The higher the level of risk, the greater the likelihood of transition to psychosis.
It is concluded that ACE-DD genotype may be a risk factor for the causation and development of chronic kidney failure among hypertensive patients.
There is evidence suggesting that certain polymorphisms in the ACE-1 gene may increase the risk of developing chronic kidney disease in hypertensive patients.

The results showed no overall first night effect on severity of RMMA frequency in young and healthy patients with SB. In clinical practice, one-night sleep recording may be sufficient for moderate-high frequency SB patients. However, low RMMA frequency in the first night could be confirmed by a second night based

There is evidence to suggest that there may be a first night effect on sleep bruxism, where individuals may experience increased tooth grinding and clenching during the first night in a new environment or when using a sleep monitoring device. However, more research is needed to fully understand this phenomenon.

We found that USMLE Step 2, number of honors in medical school clerkships, and AOA membership demonstrated the strongest correlations with resident performance. Our goal in analyzing these data was to provide residency programs at large a sense of which criteria may be "high

The residency selection criteria may provide some indication of a candidate's potential performance in an orthopaedic surgery residency, but it may not be a definitive predictor. Other factors such as work ethic, dedication, and clinical skills developed during residency can also greatly impact performance.

The analyses show that structural characteristics of a practice are not associated with uptake of a new IT facility, but that its use may be influenced by post-graduate education in the relevant clinical condition. For this diabetes system at least, practice nurse use was critical in

Yes, general practice characteristics can influence the uptake of an IT innovation in primary care. Factors such as the size of the practice, the presence of IT infrastructure, and the attitudes and beliefs of healthcare professionals can all impact the adoption and implementation of new technology.
At the gas flows studied, HFNC are not noisier than BCPAP for preterm infants.
Studies suggest that high flow nasal cannulae (HFNC) are generally quieter than bubble continuous

These results suggest that quantitative real-time PCR assays for BCRABL detection can be comparable between laboratories despite significant differences in methodologies if the same positive control cell line and quality control gene are used. It is imperative that some level of assay standardization be adopted between laboratories, not

Correlated results from homebrew assays for BCRABL transcript detection by quantitative real-time PCR are possible if the assay is properly designed, validated, and executed following established protocols and guidelines. However, it is recommended to use commercially available kits that have undergone rigorous testing for accurate and reliable results.
Adverse drug reactions were confronted with other already published case reports. Dopamine partial agonist mechanism of aripiprazole could explain the occurrence of pathological gambling.
There is evidence suggesting that aripiprazole, a medication used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, may be a risk factor for pathological gambling. Further

Biochemical analysis of injured cervical intervertebral disks reveals the presence of inflammatory markers such as MCP, fragments of structural matrix proteins such as FAC, and a correlation with pH. Further evaluation of the FAC as

Yes, the fibronectin-aggrecan complex is present in cervical disk disease. It is a key component of the extracellular matrix in the intervertebral discs and is involved in the degeneration and breakdown of the disc structure.
There are no statistically apparent motion differences between SUP-CTV and INF-CTV. Current uniform planning target volume (PTV) margins are adequate to cover both portions of the CTV.
The study found that there is no significant difference in target motion between the superior and inferior portions of the clinical target volume in prostate bed target
The second-look laparotomy doesn't have a favorable impact on overall and disease-free survival. Tumor grade is the only independent prognostic variable for survival of the patients.
The decision to offer second-look laparotomy for advanced epithelial ovarian carcinoma in Thai women should be carefully considered, weighing the potential benefits against the risks and
There is good correlation and agreement between end-tidal CO(2) and arterial CO(2) in ELBW infants in the EtCO(2) range 30-50 mmHg. End-tidal CO(2) monitoring can be helpful in trending
Studies have shown that there is a correlation between end-tidal carbon dioxide measurement and arterial carbon dioxide in extremely low birth weight infants in their first week of life.
For this pathology, the number of needles, 5 or 11, seems not to be an important variable in determining the therapeutic effect when the time of stimulation is the same in the two groups.

The number of needles used in acupuncture treatment for neck pain may vary depending on the individual's condition and the practitioner's approach. While research on the specific impact of needle quantity is limited, the

High-quality training, strict compliance with evidence-based guidelines, and thorough documentation is associated with significant reductions in CLABSIs. Mindful organizing may lead to a better understanding of what goes into a unit's ability to handle peak demands and sustain extraordinary performance in the long-term.

Achieving a zero central line-associated bloodstream infection rate is challenging but not impossible. It requires a comprehensive approach that includes proper hygiene practices, staff education, use of appropriate protocols, and continuous monitoring and improvement. While sustaining zero infections may be difficult, implementing effective
This study showed for the first time that RALP induces lower tissue trauma than RRP.
Yes, robotically assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy is generally considered to be less invasive than retropubic
According to the results of our study and the data from the international literature, the entity globulomaxillary cyst is no longer justified.
Yes, globulomaxillary cysts do exist. They are rare, benign lesions that occur between the roots of the maxillary lateral incisor and canine

Laparoscopic antireflux surgery is a safe and effective treatment for GERD even in elderly patients, warranting low morbidity and mortality rates and a significant improvement of symptoms comparable to younger patients.

Advanced age is not necessarily a contraindication to GERD laparoscopic surgery. However, the decision to undergo surgery should be made on an individual basis, considering the patient's overall health and any

In this 'at-risk' group with skin microvascular dysfunction maximal oxygen uptake was not reduced compared with healthy controls. However, in the 'at-risk' group alone, individuals with higher levels of aerobic fitness also had better microvascular and endothelial responsiveness.

Yes, aerobic fitness has been shown to have a positive influence on microvascular function in healthy adults at risk of developing Type 2 diabetes. Regular aerobic exercise can improve blood flow and increase the density of small blood

The study aims to determine whether pretreatment with estradiol and antagonist prior to microdose leuprolide in IVF improves outcomes in poor responders compared to oral contraceptive pill.

No, mossy fibers do not release gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). Mossy fibers are a type of nerve fiber found in the cerebellum that release the neurotransmitter glutamate. GABA is primarily released by inhibitory neurons in the brain.

Differences in maternal mortality are more than just differences between the rich and poor. The use of audit to identify maternal mortality in different settings is not just a difference between the rich and the poor. While socioeconomic factors can influence access to healthcare and overall maternal health outcomes, audit processes can help identify and address systemic issues in both resource-rich and resource-poor settings.

In the present study, FT and androstenedione were statistically significantly correlated with sexual desire in the total cohort of women. People presenting with type 2 diabetes with lower initial glycemia who may be earlier in the course of their disease had fewer adverse clinical outcomes despite similar glycemic progression. Since most such people are asymptomatic at diagnosis, active case detection programs would be required to identify them.

Lower fasting plasma glucose levels at diagnosis of type 2 diabetes are associated with improved outcomes, as they indicate better glycemic control and reduced risk of complications. Maintaining lower glucose levels through appropriate management strategies can lead to better long-term health outcomes for patients with type 2
